results.title: Ivan the Terrible: part 1 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Sergei Eisenstein, Alma-Ata Studios and Mosfilm
results.brief_description: Ivan the Terrible part I is Eisenstein’s boldest and most successful experiment in stylisation drawing upon other arts - Wagnerian opera, Marinsky ballet and Japanese Kabuki theatre - which he had begun in “Alexander Nevsky”. Ivan’s personal life is interwoven with the themes of his drive for empire and his alliance with the merchant class against the aristocracy. It is the first part of a trilogy; part 2 is dominated by cloak-and-dagger intrigue; part 3 which was to be in colour, was designed but not filmed. Cast includes Nikolai Cherkasov and Ludmila Tselikovskaya.

results.title: Ivan and Abraham = Moi Ivan, toi Abraham [Widescreen] [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Yolande Zauberman, Jean-Luc Ormieres, Rene Cleitman, Films Balenciaga, Hatchette Premiere and UGC Images
results.brief_description: This beautifully directed and photographed debut feature film by Franco-Polish filmmaker, Yoldande Zauberman, is set in a 1930s Polish shtetl, or small Jewish community, during a time of impending religious and political tensions leading up to Hitler’s invasion of Poland. It tells of a unique and special friendship between two young boys, Abraham (Roma Alexandrovitch), a nine year-old Jewish boy and Ivan (Sacha Iakovlev), a fourteen year-old Catholic boy, and their determination to remain best friends as religious prejudices begin to surface in the Polish community and within Abraham’s own family. When Abraham’s grandfather tries to stop the boys from seeing one another, they decide to runaway together. Added to this family drama is the alienation between Abraham’s teenage sister, Rachel (Marina Lipkina) and their father, who disapproves of Rachel’s relationship with Aaron (Vladimir Machkov), a young Communist activist. Aaron and Rachel also take flight to escape the prejudices and intolerances and to seek out Abraham and Ivan. The film focuses on these four young outcasts, their relationships and the drama of living in uncertain times. Filmed evocatively in black and white with quite an impressive young cast, “Ivan and Abraham” captures the essence of life between the Wars in Eastern Europe and the intolerances which existed, not only religiously, but politically and ethnically. Cast also includes Alexandre Kaliaguine, Helene Lapiower, Rolan Bykov, Zinovi Guerdt. In Yiddish, Polish, Russian and Gypsy dialect with English subtitles. (Awards: Cannes, 1993; Moscow, 1993)

results.title: Italy: where the past is always present
results.brief_description: Gives historical overview and examines the Italian influence on civilisation through the ages, from the rise and fall of the Roman Empire, through the Renaissance to postwar industrialisation. Looks at present day Italy and the Italian love of life and considers social and political problems such as the gap between north and south.

results.title: On the run
results.creator_credit: Pat Jackson, Derek Williams and C F F Productions
results.brief_description: A girl runs away from a welfare worker and encounters two boys. One of the boys is the son of an ousted African leader. When the girl overhears a plot by the leader’s treacherous brother to kidnap the leader’s son, she rescues him with the aid of the other boy and the trio go on the run pursued by the leader’s brother and his henchman. Stars Gordon Jackson, Denis Conoley, Robert Kennedy and Tracy Collins. Based on the book by Nina Bawden; script by Pat Jackson; camera by Stephen Dade; music by William Davies.

results.title: Italy
results.brief_description: Informative film which visits the cities and towns of Italy. A geographical overview is given and aspects of Italian life are looked at, such as the importance of religion and cultural differences between north and south. Visits Milan, Naples, Rome and the Vatican. Historical reviews of places are given, including Pompeii. Looks at wine, olive, fruit and pasta production and the contributions that Italy makes to design, furniture, clothes and the car industry.

results.title: Italianissimo 1: beginners: a BBC course for beginners in italian.
results.brief_description: Four cassettes which accompany the BBC language program on video. They contain conversations recorded for the television series, explanations and exercises, and additional authentic Italian. The student is encouraged to take part in conversational exercises designed to develop comprehension and vocabulary. The cassettes can be used in conjunction with the tapes and texts or by themselves. The videos and texts are available for loan as separate items.
